intro: Melandrium macrocalyx, commonly known as the large-flowered catchfly, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its showy, pinkish-red flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with lance-shaped leaves that are covered in fine hairs. Its flowers have five petals and are arranged in clusters at the ends of the stems. Melandrium macrocalyx is often found in grassy areas, woodland edges, and disturbed soils, where it thrives in full sun to partial shade.
